publication.TITLE: Deset dni, ki so pretresli svet
publication.SUBJECT: oktobrska revolucija
Sovjetska zveza
October revolution
Soviet Union
publication.DESCRIPTION: Knjigo Johna Reeda »Deset dni, ki so pretresli svet« sem bral z največjim zanimanjem in pozornostjo, ki ves čas ni popustila. Brez pridržka jo priporočam delavcem sveta. To je knjiga, ki bi zanjo želel, da bi bila objavljena v milijonih izvodov in prevedena v vse jezike. Resnično in kar najbolj živahno' razlaga dogodke, ki so tako pomembni za razumevanje proletarske revolucije in diktature proletariata. O teh vprašanjih se na široko diskutira, toda preden te ideje sprejmeš ali odkloniš, moraš razumeti popoln pomen svoje odločitve. Knjiga Johna Reeda bo nedvomno pomagala razjasniti to vprašanje, ki je temeljni problem mednarodnega delavskega gibanja. Konec leta 1919 V. I. LENIN

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja Dušan Kos je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.
publication.TITLE: Pismo, pisava, pisar
Prispevek k zgodovini kranjskih listin do leta 1300
publication.SUBJECT: diplomatika
listine
srednji vek
Kranjska
diplomatics
documents
Carniola
Middle Ages
publication.DESCRIPTION: Monografija je posvečena razvoju, strukturi in izvorom samostojnih privatnih listin, ki so nastajale na ozemlju modeme Kranjske od leta 1136 do leta 1300. Raziskava temelji na podlagi 405 listin do leta 1324, ohranjenih v originalih, prepisih ali regestah, ki se nahajajo v slovenskih, avstrijskih, nemških in italijanskih arhivih ter so povečini že publicirane. 41 listin iz časa med letoma 1302 in 1324 je odbranih zaradi primerjav. Natančneje so raziskane listine, ki so jih izstavile fizične in pravne osebe s sedežem na Kranjskem, listine tujih izstaviteljev pa so vzete v omej enem številu za primerjavo : listine oglejskih patriarhov, koroških vojvod, goriških grofov, vetrinjskega in gornjegrajskega samostana, briksenških in freisinških škofov. Prvi dve poglavji v monografiji sta posvečeni značaju in vsebini listin ter vplivu pravnega in političnega dogajanja, oz. nekaterim prostorskim in časovnim danostim pri odvijanju pravnih dejanj in nastajanju listin. Osrednji del monografije je analiza zunanjih in notranjih značilnosti (formul) ter diktata. Zaključni del je posvečen zgodovini in značilnostim pisarn in pisarjev na Kranjskem.

The monograph is dedicated to the development, structure and origins of the private documents originating from the territory of the medieval Carniola from the year 1136 to 1300. The basis of the research are 405 documents (1136-1324), preserved in original, in later transcription or regestum, kept in Slovenian, Austrian, German and Italian archives and are mainly already published. Researched in detail are documents issued by natural and juridical subjects with their seat in Carniola; documents of foreign issuers are considered in a limited number for comparison, e.g. the documents of the patriarchs of Aquileia, the Carinthian dukes, the Counts of Gorizia and Tyrol, the monastery of Viktring, the Brixen and Freising bishops. The first two chapters deal with the character and contents of the documents, with the influence of the juridical and political events, territorial and time facts within the development of legal action and the formation of the documents. The core part of the monograph is an analysis of the external and internal characteristics of the documents (formulas) and their order (dictation). The concluding part deals with the history of the chancery and writers in Carniola till 1300.

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja Dušan Mlacović je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.
publication.TITLE: Rogaška Slatina in zgodovina
Rogaška Slatina Thermal Spa and Its History
publication.SUBJECT: Rogaška Slatina
meščanstvo
Anin ples
Ferdinand Attems
nadvojvoda Janez
Gabriel Seidl
Juraj Strossmayer
Rogaška Slatina
urban middle class
Anna’s Dance
Ferdinand Attems
Archduke Johann
Gabriel Seidl
Juraj Strossmayer
publication.DESCRIPTION: Avtor v prispevku podaja najpomembnejše in najbolj reprezentativne poudarke iz zgodovine Rogaške Slatine, edinega velikega zdravilišča na Slovenskem, nastalega v začetku 19. stoletja. Strukturo zdravilišča in vlogo zdravilišča za zgodovino meščanstva ter političnih idej v regiji analizira s pomočjo uradne zdraviliške brošure iz leta 1922 izpod peresa slovenskega pisatelja Iva Šorlija in s pomočjo slik iz leta 1912, ki v Zdraviliški dvorani v Rogaški Slatini prikazujejo štiri dogodke iz zgodovine Rogaške Slatine.

Examined are key events in the history of the Rogaška Slatina Thermal Spa. Originating from the beginning of the 19th Century, the spa in Rogaška Slatina is the only large thermal spa in Slovenia. The paper explores its structure and the role it had played in the history of urban middle classes and in the development of politicai ideas in this region. The analysis is based on an official spa brochure, written by Slovene writer Ivo Šorli in 1922, and photographs pictures situated in the Rogaška Slatina Spa Hall. These depict four important events from the history of the Rogaška Slatina Thermal Spa.

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja Bojan Cvelfar je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.
publication.TITLE: »Evropska Slatina« v prvi polovici 19. stoletja
»The European Character of Rogaška Slatina Thermal Spa« in the First Half of the 19th Century
publication.SUBJECT: Rogaška Slatina
zdravilišče
mineralna voda
Tempel
nadvojvoda Janez
Rogaška Slatina
zdravilišče
mineralna voda
Tempel
nadvojvoda Janez
publication.DESCRIPTION: The brief period of agony at the end of the 18th century, when the mineral spring in Rogaška Slatina was being exploited by at least five landowners, was ended by the purchase of the spring and the surrounding area by the Styrian provincial diets. Representing a veritable treasure house of data, guest rosters from the first half of the 19th century are among the most valuable documents on the thermal spa. They list the number and professional structure of spa guests; their place of origin; the length of their stay; and the reason for their arrival. This period brought about considerable changes in the overall plan and design of the spa building. The life of spa’s guests, however, followed the usual routine of following their doctors’ Orders that included the drinking diet, bathing in the warm thermal water, long walks, and trips to the surrounding countryside.

Kratko dobo agonije konec 18. stoletja, ko je vrelec v Rogaški Slatini izkoriščalo vsaj pet posestnikov, so z nakupom vrelca in zemljišč okoli njega prekinili štajerski deželni stanovi. Med najbolj dragocene ohranjene dokumente o zdravilišču iz prve polovice 19. stoletja sodijo imeniki gostov. Ti so prava zakladnica podatkov o številu, poklicnem in krajevnem izvoru gostov, trajanju in vzroku njihovega bivanja v Rogaški Slatini. Pri stavbni zasnovi je ta doba prinesla ogromne spremembe. Samo življenje v zdravilišču pa so narekovala zdravniška navodila, predvsem pitna kura, kopanje, sprehodi ter izleti v bližnjo okolico.

publication.TITLE: Slovenija ante portas! ≫Evropska (ne) podpora osamosvojitvi Slovenije≪
Slovenia ante portas! ≫European (Lack of) Support of Slovene Independance≪
publication.SUBJECT: mednarodno priznanje
zunanja politika
Dimitrij Rupel
Jože Pučnik
Helmut Kohl
Gianni de Michelis
Brionska deklaracija
priznanje Slovenije
osamosvojitev Slovenije
international recognition
foreign politics
Dimitrij Rupel
Jože Pučnik
Helmut Kohl
Gianni de Michelis
Brioni Declaration
recognition of independent Slovenia
attainment of Slovene independence
publication.DESCRIPTION: V prispevku Slovenija ante portas! Evropska (ne) podpora osamosvojitvi Slovenije avtorica analizira evropsko politiko do razpadanja Jugoslavije do naklonjenosti priznanju novih mednarodnih subjektov Slovenije in Hrvaške. Ugotavlja, da so k mednarodnemu priznanju Slovenije bistveno prispevale evropske krščanskodemokratske konzervativne politične sile in da je jugoslovanska kriza našla Evropsko skupnost nepripravljeno.

Analyzed is the position of European politics on the disintegration of Yugoslavia and its subsequent policy up to its later more benevolent disposition toward the recognition of independent Slovenia and Croatia. While the European Union was largely unprepared for the Yugoslav crisis conservative European Christian Democratic politicians contributed significantly to the international recognition of independent Slovenia

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja Zdenko Čepič je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.
publication.TITLE: Evropa zdaj! Programski pogledi slovenskih političnih strank, predvsem slovenskih komunistov na ≫Evropo≪ v procesu demokratizacije in osamosvajanja
Europe Now! (The programme standpoints of Slovenian political parties, especially Slovenian communists, in regard to ≫Europe≪ in the process of democratisation and the attainment of Independence)
publication.SUBJECT: Slovenija
Jugoslavija
politika
politične stranke
politični program
Zveza komunistov Slovenije
Slovenia
Yugoslavia
politics
political parties
political program
the League of Communists of Slovenia
publication.DESCRIPTION: V iskanje poti iz vsesplošne krize, v kateri je bila jugoslovanska država, se je oblikoval v Sloveniji proces demokratizacije. Ta je bil pogoj za osamosvojitev. S tem procesom demokratizacije, kot t. i. prenoviteljstvom, je začela Zveza komunistov Slovenije. Reformna politika ZKS je vrh dosegla konec leta 1989, ko je predstavila program ≫Za evropsko kakovost življenja≪. V njem je predstavila program pogledov slovenskih komunistov na celotno družbeno, politično, gospodarsko in socialno problematiko. Program je postal pod naslovom ≫Evropa zdaj!≪ tudi volilni program slovenskih komunistov za večstrankarske volitve aprila 1990. Bistvo programa ni bila napoved evropskega povezovanja, ampak da bi začeli ≫evropsko≪ živeti tukaj in zdaj.

In the course of trying to find a way out of the ovarall crisis within the state of Yugoslavia in the process of democratization in Slovenia, which was a necessary prerequisite for the attainment of Slovene independence, started to take shape. This process, also known as the renovation of the Communist Party, was initiated by the League of Communists of Slovenia. The League’s set of reforms culminated at the end of 1989 with the presentation of a program named ≫For the European Quality of Life”, in which Slovene communists listed their views on issues of social, politicai, societal, and economic nature. Known as ≫Europe Now!≪this program became the platform of Slovene communists in the multi-party elections in Aprii 1990. Rather than an announcement of European integration its principal idea was to start living ≫the European way≪in the here and now.

Based on archival sources and literature, the paper explores the formation of Slovene armed forces as a result of geopolitical changes in Europe in the second half of the 20th Century.

publication.TITLE: Podobnosti in razlike med slovenskim (jugoslovanskim) in vzhodnoevropskim tipom socializma
Similarities and Differences between the Slovene (Yugoslav) and East European Types of Socialism
publication.SUBJECT: politični sistem
Jugoslavija
spor z Informbirojem
socializem
samoupravljanje
totalitarizem
avtokracija
historiografija
politicai system
Yugoslavia
conflict with the Cominform
socialism
self-management
totalitarianism
autocracy
historiography
publication.DESCRIPTION: Avtor v prispevku prikazuje razlike in podobnosti med slovenskim (jugoslovanskim) tipom socializma in tistim v vzhodnoevropskih državah. Izhaja iz stališča, da so med posameznimi socialističnimi državami prav tako velike razlike kot med posameznimi kapitalističnimi državami. Razlike so tudi znotraj držav v posameznih časovnih obdobjih. Po navedbi podobnosti in razlik zaključi, da današnja definicija slovenske (jugoslovanske) družbe kot totalitaristične do leta 1990 ni upravičena in da se je Slovenija od petdesetih let dalje postopoma demokratizirala. ≫Vmesnost≪ Slovenije (in Jugoslavije) med dvema sistemoma in dvema blokoma bo vsaj s historiografskega stališča torej še naprej ostala zgodovinsko dejstvo.

Explored are differences and similarities between the Slovene (Yugoslav) type of socialism and that of East European countries. The author posits that differences between socialist countries are just as marked as differences between capitalist ones. There are also différences within individual countries and in different periods. In conclusion, the author suggests that the present widely embraced conviction that up to the 1990s thè Slovene (Yugoslav) society was a totalitarian one is hardly justified; indeed, since the 1950s it became increasingly more democratic. The position of Slovenia, as well as Yugoslavia, »in-between« the two systems and blocs shall, at least from the historiographic perspective, remain a historic fact.

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja Boris Mlakar je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.
publication.TITLE: Nacistična ≫Nova Evropa≪ in Slovenci
The Nazi Concept of the »New Europe« and Slovenes
publication.SUBJECT: druga svetovna vojna
nacizem
propaganda
Nova Evropa
okupacija
Slovenija
Second World War
Nazism
propaganda
New Europe
occupation
Slovenia
publication.DESCRIPTION: Nacistična propaganda je posebej po porazu pri Stalingradu vojno na evropskih tleh pričela prikazovati ne več samo kot prizadevanje za pridobitev novega življenjskega prostora za germansko raso na vzhodu, temveč tudi kot odločilni obrambni boj za Evropo in njene vrednote pred navalom židovskega boljševizma z vzhoda oziroma kapitalistične plutokracije z zahoda. S tem se je vsaj formalno povečal prostor za diskusije o ureditvi Evrope po morebitni nemški zmagi. V te diskusije so bili ob novi narodnostni politiki nacistične uprave v ≫Jadranskem primorju≪ potegnjeni tudi protirevolucionarni in kvizlinški subjekti na Slovenskem. Rezultatov razen določene avtonomije Ljubljanske pokrajine pod vodstvom Rupnika ni bilo, bilo pa je mnogo propagandnega govorjenja o Novi Evropi ter o sicer povsem nedoločenem mestu Slovenije v njej.

During the Second World War, and particularly after the German defeat in the Battle of Stalingrad, the Nazi propaganda started to depict the war in Europe no longer as solely an attempt to acquire new territory for the Germanie race in the eastern part of Europe; it was also a crucial defensive struggle to protect Europe and its values from the onslaught of Jewish Bolshevist ideas from the east and the capitalist plutocracy from the west. This concept increased, at least formally, the space for discussion about the new European order after the eventual German victory. The new national policy of the Nazi administration in the ≫Adriatic Littoral≪ included the engagement of Slovene antirevolutionaries and quislings. Apart from a certain degree of autonomy in the Province of Ljubljana under the leadership of Leon Rupnik this method yielded no marked results; there was, however, a lot of propaganda conceming the New Europe and the (wholly unspecified) place Slovenia would occupy within it.

publication.TITLE: Slovensko odporništvo med drugo svetovno vojno v evropskih primerjavah
Slovenian Resistance Movement during World War II in European Comparisons
publication.SUBJECT: Evropa

publication.DESCRIPTION: Druga svetovna vojna je potekala kot spopad dveh vojnih koalicij, ki sta se srdito bojevali za dve viziji svetovnega reda ter prerazdelitev moči, in je imela značaj totalnosti. Dimenzijo totalnega značaja vojne je soustvarjal tudi pojav odporniških gibanj, ki so se pojavila kot reakcija na izgubo neodvisnosti držav oziroma narodov, na konkretne ukrepe okupatorjev in perspektivo, ki sta jo okupacija in fašizem nasploh prinašala. Avtorica na primeru izbranih držav obravnava najpomembnejše vidike odporništva kot večplastnega pojava v kompleksnem dogajanju okupirane Evrope in jih primerja s posameznimi vidiki in razsežnostmi odpora slovenskega naroda kot enega manjših v Evropi.

World War II was carried on as a clash between two war coalitions which fought angrily for two visions of world order and for a redistribution of power, and had a character of totality. The war’s character of totality was co-created by the emergence of resistance movements, which arose as a response to the loss of independence of countries or nations, to the concrete measures of occupiers and to the overall prospect that occupation and Fascism brought with them. The author, on the basis of select countries, explores the most important aspects of the resistance movement as a multilayered phenomenon in the complex occurrences of occupied Europe and compares them with individual aspects and dimensions of the resistance of the Slovenian nation as one of the smaller ones in Europe.

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja Andrej Pančur je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.
publication.TITLE: Judje s Spodnje Štajerske in Gorenjske kot žrtve holokavsta v Evropi
Jews of Lower Styria and Upper Carniola as Holocaust Victims in Europe
publication.SUBJECT: Spodnja Štajerska
Gorenjska
Jugoslavija
druga svetovna vojna
Judje

begunci
izgnanci

Upper Carniola
Yugoslavia
Second World War
Jews
the Holocaust
Nazism
refugees
exiles
publication.DESCRIPTION: The history of the Holocaust shows great regional différences, which only become clear when they are placed within a wider European context. The exclusion of Jews from society, the deprivation of civil and human rights, their expropriation, exile or déportation and their slavery are those stages of Jew persécution which eventually led to the systematic murder of Jews in Nazi Europe. At a local level these general stages were carried out in an entirely different time and content; in Germany gradually ever since 1933, and elsewhere more or less quickly by adopting local anti-Jew législation, spreading German influence and/or by German occupation. In the territories of Lower Styria and Upper Camiola, later occupied by Germany, very few Jews resided before the war (some 250). They were mostly immigrants from thè middle and upper classes. Among these there was a relatively high number of immigrants with foreign citizenship. Many originated from Central European countries, where they had already been subjected to various types o f persécution due to the spread of Nazi authority (Germany, Austria, Czechoslovakia). The Jews from these countries, which had been living in Yugoslavia for some time, applied for Yugoslav citizenship, while at the same time, more and more Jewish refugees entered thè country. The Yugoslav national authorities consequently exercised an increasingly restrictive policy towards Jewish refugees and citizenship applicants, and eventually accepted two anti-Jewish decrees in October 1940. The genuine persécution of the Jewish population in Lower Styria and Upper Camiola began after the defeat of Yugoslavia in the April war of 1941, when Germany occupied both provinces. That was why most Jews immediately fled to safety in the direction of Italy. Since there were only so few Jews left, they were at first persecuted together with racially and politically unwanted Slovenians (citizenship deprivation, confiscation of property, exile into Serbia or Croatia). It was only on Ist April, 1942 that the Nurenberg race laws came into effect in Lower Styria, while these laws were never passed in Upper Camiola. However, at that time there were practically no Jews left in this région for the occupier to lead to their deaths at the concentration camps. In this regard, the Holocaust in Lower Styria and Upper Camiola was carried out quite differently as elsewhere in German Europe, where the Jewish population was persecuted separately and far more radically than other groups of unwanted population. After the second half of 1941, when the Holocaust of the occupied East began to spread over the remaining European Jews, Lower Styria and Upper Camiola were already »free of Jews«. The Jewish refugees and exiles thus suffered the Holocaust in other European countries, particularly in Italy, Serbia, Croatia and Hungary. Among the mass of the remaining refugees and exiles, a great deal outlasted the battle against time, yet there were quite a few that had not survived the Holocaust.

Zgodovina holokavsta izkazuje velike regionalne razlike, katere pridejo jasno do izraza šele z umestitvijo v širši evropski kontekst. Na kasnejšem nemškem okupacijskem območju Spodnje Štajerske (Untersteiermark) in Gorenjske (Besetzte Gebiete Karntens und Krains) je pred vojno živelo relativno malo Judov, med katerimi jih je veliko izviralo iz srednjeevropskih držav, kjer so bili Judje že podvrženi različnim oblikam preganjanja. Aprila 1941 se je z okupacijo to preganjanje razširilo še na tiste, ki pred okupatorjem niso pobegnili na varno. Sprva so jih preganjali skupaj z rasno in politično nezaželenimi Slovenci (odvzem državljanstva, zaplemba premoženja, izgon v Srbijo in na Hrvaško). Šele 1. aprila 1942 so na Spodnjem Štajerskem začeli veljati nürnberški rasni zakoni, na Gorenjskem pa ti zakoni sploh nikoli niso bili uveljavljeni. Toda takrat tam praktično ni bilo več Judov, nad katerimi bi okupator izvajal holokavst, temveč so ti Judje postali žrtve holokavsta v drugih evropskih deželah.

publication.TITLE: Vplivi krepitve fašistične in nacistične oblasti v Italiji in Nemčiji na ukrepe za povečanje bojne pripravljenosti Vojske Kraljevine Jugoslavije, s poudarkom na območju Dravske banovine

Impact of the Strengthening of the Fascist and Nazi Authority in Italy and Germany on the Measures to Increase Combat Readiness of the Army of the Kingdom of Yugoslavia, with Emphasis on the Drava Banovina Region

publication.DESCRIPTION: Slovenski prostor je na strateško izredno občutljivem območju, zato nas ne presenečajo težnje velikih sil, da bi na tem prostoru nadzirale omenjene poti. Med obema svetovnima vojnama so se ta prizadevanja še okrepila, zlasti v drugi polovici 30. let 20. stoletja, še bolj pa po anšlusu, ko je dobila Kraljevina Jugoslavija za sosedo nacistično Nemčijo. Vojska Kraljevine Jugoslavije je bila prisiljena sprejemati več ukrepov za povečanje bojne pripravljenosti države, ki pa so se na koncu izkazali kot neučinkoviti. V svojem prispevku je avtor analiziral te ukrepe, opisal vojaško organiziranost v Kraljevini Jugoslaviji s poudarkom na območju Dravske banovine in prikazal enega najpomembnejših ukrepov, ki je pustil svoj pečat na Slovenskem, sistem utrdb na meji, ki se je vtisnil v slovenski zgodovinski spomin z imenom Rupnikova linija.

Slovenian space is located at a strategically highly sensitive area and it is therefore not surprising that the great powers strive to control the aforementioned paths. These aspirations were further strengthened between the two world wars, especially during the second half of the 1930s, and even more so after the Anschluss, when the Kingdom of Yugoslavia became neighbours with Nazi Germany. The army of the Kingdom of Yugoslavia was forced to accept several measures to increase the country’s combat readiness, which in the end tumed out to be ineffective. In his contribution, the author has analysed these measures, described the organisation of the army in the Kingdom of Yugoslavia, with an emphasis on the area of Drava Banovina, and presented one of the most important measures, which made its mark on Slovenia, the system of border fortresses, impressed on Slovenian historical memory by the name ‘the Rupnik line’.

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja France Kresal je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.
publication.TITLE: Primerjava razvojnih značilnosti jugoslovanskega delovnega prava s sovjetskim do leta 1953
A Comparison of Developmental Characteristics of Yugoslav Labor Law with the Soviet Labor Law Prior to 1953
publication.SUBJECT: delovno pravo
Jugoslavija
Sovjetska zveza
labor law
Yugoslavia
the Soviet Union
publication.DESCRIPTION: Primerjava sovjetskega delovnega prava z razvojem jugoslovanskega je možna le deloma. Sovjetsko delovno pravo se je razvilo od skoraj popolnega začetka po revolucionarnem prevzemu oblasti (Kodeks zakona o delu iz leta 1918) in je v razmerah socialistične ureditve doseglo svoj vrh z določbami o delavski zaščiti v okviru ustave ZSSR iz leta 1936. Tako oblikovano sovjetsko delovno pravo je od konca druge svetovne vojne do uvedbe delavskega samoupravljanja tudi na področju družbenih služb leta 1953 vplivalo na razvoj jugoslovanskega.

A comparison of the Soviet labor law with the development of the Yugoslav labor law is possible only partially. Having developed after the revolutionary takeover of control (1918 Labor Act Code), the Soviet labor law operated under a socialist regime, achieving its pinnacle with the provisions on workers protection within the 1936 Constitution of the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics. This form of the Soviet labor law influenced the development of the Yugoslav labor law in the period between the end of the Second World War until the introduction of workers’ self-management, also in the area of public services, in 1953.

publication.TITLE: Med odmevi in vplivi: oblikovanje norveške nacionalne in kulturne "identitete do druge svetovne vojne ter njegovi odmevi in vplivi na Slovenskem
Between reflections and influences: Slovenian reflections on the formation of the Norwegian national and cultural identity until World War II
publication.SUBJECT: nacionalno oblikovanje
nacionalna identiteta
Norveška
vplivi in odmevi na Slovenskem
national formation
national identity
Norway
influences and reactions in Slovenia
publication.DESCRIPTION: V svojem prispevku se v kontekstu primerjav z nacionalnim oblikovanjem Slovencev osredotočam na kratek pregled oblikovanja norveške nacionalne identitete v 19. stoletju in v času pred drugo svetovno vojno. Ob nedvomnih vplivih norveške kulture (literature, še posebej dramatike, glasbe in slikarstva) na proces ustvarjanja in krepitve slovenske identitete v času med obema vojnama, namenjam posebno pozornost odmevom osamosvajanja Norveške v letu 1905 v slovenskem časopisju. Norveško nacionalno oblikovanje je vplivalo tudi na prelom v slovenskem liberalnem taboru, ki se je zgodil z izdajo knjige Josipa Vidmarja Kulturni problem slovenstva, kar obravnavam v zadnjem delu prispevka.

By exploring certain parallels with the formation of Slovene national identity this paper brings a brief overview of the formation of Norwegian national identity in the 19th Century and in the period prior to the Second World War. During the interwar period Norwegian culture, particularly literature and especially drama, music, and painting exerted considérable influence upon the process of création and strengthening of Slovene national identity. Of special interest were reactions in Slovene newspapers to the attainment of Norwegian independence in 1905. The formation of Norwegian national identity also influenced the rupture within thè Slovene Liberal Party brought about by the publication of Josip Vidmar’s book Kulturni problem slovenstva (Cultural Issues of Being Slovene); this is discussed in the last part of the paper.

publication.DESCRIPTION: V Sloveniji so si komunisti po drugi svetovni vojni oblast zagotovili tako, da so večplastni osvobodilni boj proti okupatorju izkoristili za svoje načrte o prevzemu oblasti, ga izkrivili in izrabili zase. Uspelo jim ga je izenačiti s komunističnim odporom in predstavnike nekomunističnih tokov izločiti kot »kolaboracioniste«. Ta falzifikat je učinkovit še danes - tudi kot posledica ideološko pobarvanih učbenikov. Začeli so ga graditi 16.9.1941, ko je Vrhovni plenum OF monopoliziral odpor in sprejet t. i. »zaščitni odlok«. Prispevek bo prikazal nastanek in razvoj tega falzifikata, ki je imel za posledico številne zločine, tudi povojne množične pomore, izločitev vsake opozicije v deželi, zapiranje in sojenje nasprotnikov, proticerkveno naravnane prisilne ukrepe, izselitve itd.

At the end of the Second World War, communists in Slovenia seized power by manipulating, adjusting, and distorting the multi-layered national liberation war to correspond to their own plans. A resuit of their successful manipulation was that the war for the liberation of Yugoslavia and Slovenia was perceived as communist resistance and all non-communists branded as »collaborators.« Largely due to ideologically distorted textbooks for history this falsification is still in effect. It was b om on September 16, 1941, when the Liberation Front Supreme Plenum passed the so-called protective decree and monopolized the resistance. The paper will examine the origin and the development of this falsification that resulted in numerous crimes, mass executions after the war, elimination of any opposition, imprisonment and trial of politicai opponents, forced measures against representatives and supporters of the Catholic Church, deportations, etc.

European Influences on the Agrarian Movement in the Drava Province and Their Impact upon the Liberal-Unitarian and upon the Catholic Camps between 1929 and 1941
publication.SUBJECT: obdobje 1929-1941

publication.DESCRIPTION: Avtorica v svojem referatu prikazuje kmečko gibanje v Dravski banovini, kije sprejemalo v svojem programu novodobne evropske vplive v zadnjem desetletju prve Jugoslavije. Liberalna Pucljeva Samostojna kmetijska stranka, kasnejša Slovenska kmetska stranka oziroma Zveza slovenskih kmetov, se je navduševala za slovanski agrarizem. Brodarjevi Kmečki zvezi pa je bila vzor katoliška belgijska Kmečka zveza, prijateljsko pa je sodelovala še s češkoslovaško katoliško kmečko organizacijo Svazom lidovych zemeldelcu ceskoslovenskych. Ob tem je pregledno orisana dejavnost v obeh političnih taborih pri uresničevanju »novodobnega programa reformističnega mladega kmečkega gibanja« v smeri stanovstva, ki pa je ostalo na pol poti.

The author analyzes the agrarian movement in the Drava Province that in the last decade of the first Yugoslav state was open to European influence and adopted new ideas in its platform. The liberal Independent Farmers’ Party (Samostojna kmetijska stranka, later Slovenska kmetska stranka or Zveza slovenskih kmetov), led by Ivan Pucelj, enthusiastically supported the Slavic agrarian movement while the Belgian catholic Farmers’ League served as a model to Brodar’s Farmers’ League (Kmečka zveza); the latter also fostered friendly ties with Svazom lidovych zemedelcu ceskoslovenskych, a Czechoslovakian catholic farmers organization. Examined are activities in both politicai camps and their attempts to accomplish ≫the modem program of the young reformist agrarian movement≪ as well as establish a special peasant estate; however, this goal remained only halfway.

The Issue of Nation in Slovene Print of 1932
publication.SUBJECT: slovensko narodno vprašanje

publication.DESCRIPTION: Razprava prinaša pregled in analizo polemike v slovenskem časopisju leta 1932, po izidu knjige Josipa Vidmarja Kulturni problem slovenstva. Polemika je izčistila odnos do slovenskega narodnega vprašanja iz različnih političnih zornih kotov ter spodbudila refleksijo. Ugotovila pa je pomanjkanje medsebojne strpnosti in potrebo po odkriti, celovito argumentirani izmenjavi mnenj med Slovenci.

Analyzed is the debate on thè Slovene national question that appeared in Slovene newspapers in 1932, following thè publication of Josip Vidmar’s book titled Kulturni problem slovenstva (Cultural Issues of Being Slovene). The debate clarifìed different perspectives and prompted reflection on the Slovene national question. It also demonstrated a lack of mutual tolerance and a need for a sincere exchange of views based on valid argumentation.

Slovenian Domestic Interior Design in the Context of European Twentieth Century

publication.DESCRIPTION: 20. stoletje je tudi Slovencem prineslo burne čase. Doživeli smo tri vojne, štiri zaporedne države in nekaj vzporednih, pa dvakrat preskok v diametralno nasprotna si politična in gospodarska sistema. Vse to se je seveda poznalo tudi na kulturni ravni. Na starodavni srednjeevropski podlagi so izstopali vplivi zdaj enega zdaj drugega sosednjega ali bolj oddaljenega kulturnega okolja. Zelo neposredno je mogoče slediti tem menjavam skozi razvoj stanovanjske kulture, predvsem pohištva. V sto letih se je korenito spremenila struktura naročnikov in kupcev. Ob manj zahtevni večini prej kmečkega prebivalstva in malomeščanstva, zdaj delavstva, je maloštevilno plemstvo in številčnejše premožno meščanstvo kot glavni nosilec kulture nadomestil širši sloj izobražencev. Kot snovalci pohištva so se obrtnim mojstrom in absolventom srednjih tehnično-oblikovnih šol v večjem številu pridružili univerzitetno izobraženi arhitekti in drugi.

The stormy 20th Century proved to be turbulent also for Slovenes. They endured three wars, lived in four consecutive states - as well as some parallel ones - and experienced two leaps into diametrically opposite political and economic systems. All of these certainly had a profound impact upon the Slovene culture. Built on ancient Central European foundations, influences from various cultures, both from the vicinity or from afar, grew and diminished. It is possible to trace them almost directly through the development of interior design, particularly furniture. The structure of furniture consumers changed drastically in the course of the Century. At the time when the rural population (now the working class) with a relatively unpretentious taste was predominant the sparse nobility and the more numerous well-to-do urban middle classes represented the principal transmitters of culture; later on have been replaced by a wider circle of cultural elite. Formerly designed by master craftsmen and later on by graduates of design and technical high schools fumiture is now largely designed by university graduate engineers of architecture and others.

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja Aleš Gabrič je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.
publication.TITLE: Slovenska kultura pod sovjetskim vplivom
Slovene Culture under the Influence of the Soviet Union
publication.SUBJECT: slovenska kultura
sovjetski vpliv
kulturno sodelovanje
Slovene culture
Soviet influence
cultural cooperation
publication.DESCRIPTION: The close political attachment of Yugoslavia, and with it also of Slovenia, to the Soviet Union immediately after the Second World War brought about the strengthening of cultural ties between the two countries as Slovenia started to follow Soviet cultural and political models. However, the Cominform conflict between Yugoslavia and the Soviet Union effectively ended this and considerably diminished cultural coopération between the two countries; the variables of the intensity of their cultural exchange are indicated by a number of statistical data. However, the changes in cultural politics nevertheless did not dispense with control over cultural production but merely reformed control techniques.

Tesna politična naslonitev Jugoslavije na Sovjetsko zvezo takoj po koncu druge svetovne vojne je v Jugoslavijo in s tem tudi Slovenijo prinesla tudi posnemanje sovjetskega kulturnopolitičnega modela in krepitev kulturnega sodelovanja s Sovjetsko zvezo. Toda po informbirojevskem sporu med Jugoslavijo in Sovjetsko zvezo je bilo kmalu konec posnemanja sovjetskega kulturnega vzora, opazen pa je bil tudi zastoj pri kulturnem sodelovanju. Spreminjanje intenzivnosti kulturnega sodelovanja prikazujejo številni statistični kazalci, spremembe v kulturni politiki pa niso odpravile nadzora nad kulturno ustvarjalnostjo, temveč le reformirale način nadzora.

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja Marta Rendla je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.
publication.TITLE: Vplivi zahodnih trendov na slovensko popularno glasbo
Western Influences on Slovenian Pop Music
publication.SUBJECT: zahodni vplivi (ameriški in evropski)
popularna slovenska glasba
jazz
popevkarstvo

Western influences (American and European)
popular Slovene music
jazz
pop songs
beat
rock
punk
publication.DESCRIPTION: Avtorica na podlagi literature in popularnega tiska (Tedenska tribuna, Antena) prikaže razvoj slovenske popularne glasbe v času po drugi svetovni vojni - od osvoboditve do osemdesetih let - kako in v kakšni meri so vplivali zahodni trendi na nastanek in razvoj množičnih glasbenih oblik v državi s socialističnim sistemom. Intenzivnost seznanjanja z zahodnimi glasbenimi smernicami, ki so po prvi svetovni vojni začele krojiti svetovno glasbeno prizorišče, je bila pri nas odvisna od danih družbeno političnih razmer oziroma od jugoslovanskega odpiranja proti zahodnemu svetu. V povojnem obdobju so se kot oblike slovenske popularne glasbe, ki so z zamikom ali pa skoraj sočasno sledile razvoju Zahoda, zvrstile jazzovska glasbena zvrst, pop glasba s popevkami in beat slogom, rockovska in punkovska glasba.

Based on an analysis of literature and popular magazines (Tedenska tribuna, Antena) the paper discusses the development of Slovene popular music in the period between the end of the Second World War and the 1980s, examining how, and to what degree, Western trends influenced the appearance and development of music forms in socialist Slovenia. The intensity of contacts with these musical trends that at that time started to shape the overall music scene, depended upon the current politicai circumstances and ideology in Slovenia and, as a result, the willingness of Yugoslavia to open to Western influences. The various music genres that appeared in Slovenia after the Second World War, which followed the Western trends shortly or with a longer interval, included jazz, pop music with pop songs and beat music, rock, and punk.

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja Jože Dežman je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.
publication.TITLE: Sistem ohranjanja in razvijanja revolucionarnih izročil
Religijski temelj in režimski zgodovinski falzifikat titoizma
The System of Maintaining and Developing Revolutionary Traditions of the Past
A Religious Basis and Historie Falsification of Titoism
publication.SUBJECT: Slovenija
boljševizem

sistem ohranjanja in razvijanja revolucionarnih izročil
državljanska vojna

rasizem
Slovenia
Bolshevism
Titoism
system of maintaining and developing revolutionary traditions
civil war
class and ethnie cleansing
racism
publication.DESCRIPTION: Sistem ohranjanja in razvijanja revolucionarnih izročil je bil ideološki mehanizem, ki je s kultnimi obrazci prikrival zločine in neuspehe Komunistične partije/Zveze komunistov Slovenije/Jugoslavije. Konec 2. svetovne vojne ne pomeni osvoboditve, ampak nadaljevanje boljševistične agresije (razredno, etnično, versko, kulturno »čiščenje«). V maju in juniju 1945 so pomorili več kot en odstotek prebivalstva Slovenije. Pod geslom bratstva in enotnosti pride do rasistične delitve živih in mrtvih, enopartijske diktature in kršenja temeljnih človekovih pravic. Brez pravice do groba in spomina je ostala skoraj polovica od okoli 90.000 smrtnih žrtev vojne in revolucije. Vlogo boga prevzame diktator Josip Broz Tito. Zgrajena je bila nova simbolna krajina. Neodvisna Republika Slovenija je po letu 1991 sprejela številne ukrepe za preseganje bremen preteklosti, zakonski in drugi ukrepi pa so predmet intenzivnih javnih, političnih in strokovnih razprav.

The system of maintaining and developing revolutionary traditions was an ideological mechanism that, with the help of cult forms, concealed the crimes and failures of the Yugoslav Communist Party and the League of Communists of Slovenia/Yugoslavia. Rather than liberation, the end of the Second World War denoted the continuation of the Bolshevik aggression, manifested in class, ethnic, religious and cultural »cleansing«. More than one percent of the entire Slovene population was murdered in May and June 1945. Under the slogan of »brotherhood and unity« stood for racist division of the living and the dead, one-party dictatorship, and violation of human rights were perpetrated. Almost one half of approximately 90,000 Slovene victims of war and revolution were denied their own grave and the right to be remembered. The role of god was taken over by dictator Josip Broz Tito. New political symbolism was constructed in this period. After 1991, the newly-independent Republic of Slovenia took measures for overcoming the heavy burden of the past, with legal measures and other provisions being the subject of heated public, politicai, and expert debates.

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja Egon Pelikan je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.
publication.TITLE: Slovenski politični katolicizem v tridesetih letih v luči evropskih vplivov
European Influence upon Slovene Political Catholicism in the 1930s
publication.SUBJECT: Evropa
politični katolicizem
Cerkev
Slovenija
idejni vpliv
Europe
political Catholicism
the Church
Slovenia
influential ideas
publication.DESCRIPTION: V prispevku avtor opozarja na idejne vsebine in politične strategije v taboru slovenskega političnega katolicizma, ki so bile v času med obema vojnama na Slovensko prinesene iz Evrope. Ob tem so bile omenjene strategije na Slovenskem aplicirane s posebnostmi, ki pa v bistvu potrjujejo tezo o pomembnosti evropskih vplivov na slovenski politični katolicizem. Ti vplivi so bili za razvoj znotraj Cerkve in političnega katolicizma v času med obema vojnama in med drugo svetovno vojno odločilni. Drugi odločilni tok zgodovine slovenskega političnega katolicizma v času med obema vojnama pa je mogoče razumeti skozi specifično vlogo na relaciji nacionalno vprašanje - modernizacija od konca 19. stoletja do druge svetovne vojne.

Examined are ideological factors and politicai stratégies, brought to Slovenia from Europe during thè interwar period, within Slovene catholically oriented politicai parties. Although these stratégies contained certain distinctive features they nevertheless confirm the general European influence on Slovene politicai Catholicism. In the years between the two world wars and during the Second World War this influence proved to be crucial for the inner development of the Catholic Church and thè catholic politicai movement. The second significant factor in the history of Slovene politicai Catholicism is the specific role of the national question issue in relation to modemization in the period between the end of the 19th Century and the onset of the Second World War.

publication.TITLE: OZNA - vojaška protiobveščevalna ali zločinsko-genocidna organizacija?
The OZNA - A Military Counterintelligence or a Criminal and Genocidal Organization?
publication.SUBJECT: vojaška obveščevalna in protiobveščevalna služba

publication.DESCRIPTION: V članku opredeljujem dilemo o vlogi in značaju Ozne kot vojaško obveščevalne in protiobveščevalne organizacije, ki je nastala na podlagi sovjetskih vzgledov - konkretno SMERŠA in kot taka bila udeležena v povojnih obračunih z nasprotniki partizanskega gibanja. Od ustanovitve do marca 1946 je delovala v okviru ministrstva za obrambo, nato pa je v njem ostal le njen III. odsek, ki se je preimenoval v KOS JA, medtem ko so ostali odseki Ozne prešli v ministrstvo za notranje zadeve in se preimenovali v Upravo državne varnosti, - UDBO in opravljali funkcijo politične policije. Ne glede na to so pripadniki UDBe do leta 1952 ostali vojaške osebe. Šele tega leta so bili demobilizirani.

Investigated is the dilemma about the role and character of the OZNA (Department for Protection of the People). A military intelligence and counterintelligence organization, the OZNA was pattemed after the SMERŠ. Its abbreviations literally denoting Death to Spies, the SMERŠ was the Russian counterintelligence agency. The OZN A participated in post-war executions of those who were not supporters of the partisan movement. It operated within the Ministry of Defense until March 1946 when all but its third unit were allotted to the Ministry of Interior Affairs and renamed the UDBA (State Security Administration), which was, in fact, the political police (secret police); the third unit was renamed KOS JA (Counterintelligence Agency of the Yugoslav Army). Members of the UDBA remained in military service until 1952 when they were demobilized.

Czechoslovakian Influences on Slovene Politics and the Latter’s Position on the National Question after 1918
publication.SUBJECT: Čehi

publication.DESCRIPTION: Močan češki vpliv na slovensko družbo in politiko, ki smo mu priča zlasti v drugi polovici 19. stoletja, se je v precejšnji meri ohranil tudi po razpadu Avstro-Ogrske. Proti Pragi je bil po letu 1918 usmerjen zlasti liberalni del slovenske politike, saj sta povsem po čeških vzorih nastali narodno socialistična in kmetijska stranka. Zaradi primerljivih (med)nacionalnih razmer v češko-slovaški in jugoslovanski državi pa je določene vplive in paralele mogoče najti tudi v odnosu političnih strank do narodnega vprašanja tako na domačih kot tujih tleh.

The influence of Bohemia on Slovene politics and society, particularly strong in the second half of the 19th Century, did not cease after thè disintegration of Austria-Hungary. Slovene libérais in particular sought inspiration in Prague; this resulted in the formation of the National Socialist Party and the Independent Farmers’ Party, both modeled after Czech politicai parties. In view of comparable (inter)national circumstances in Czechoslovakia and in Yugoslavia certain influences and parallels can be found also in the position of their political parties on the national question, both at home and abroad.

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja Marjan Drnovšek je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.
publication.TITLE: Pogledi na "domovino" in "tujino" skozi optiko izseljenstva
Immigrant View of the "Homeland" Versus "Foreign Countries"
publication.SUBJECT: domovina vs. tujina
slovensko izseljenstvo
19. in 20. stoletje
stereotipi
miti
homeland versus foreign countries
Slovene immigration
19th and 20th centuries
stereotypes
myths
publication.DESCRIPTION: Izseljenstvo je pojav, ki z odhodom ljudi v tujino sproži številne emocionalne reakcije, povezane z zapustitvijo družine, naroda ali države. Odnos ‘domovine’ in ‘tujine’je eno od področij, kjer se oblikujejo tako mitske kot stereotipne »podobe v glavah ljudi« (W. Lippman). Avtor prispevka poudarja nekatere poglede slovenske javnosti na tujino z vidika izseljevanja in podobe novega okolja, v 19. in 20. stoletju (vzorčni pristop). Ugotavlja, da so v glavnem odklonilni, negativni in celo zgroženi v duhu misli, da je izseljevanje »rakrana na telesu našega naroda«, kar se je potencirano poudarjalo v času množičnega izseljevanja (Združene države Amerike) in v tridesetih letih 20. stoletja.

The act of leaving one’s homeland permanently triggers a number of emotional responses. Immigrants leave behind their family, nation, and state. W. Lippman states that one’s attitude toward their “homeland” and toward »foreign lands« is one of the areas that foster formation of mythic and stereotype “notions in people’s heads” . Discussed is Slovene public opinion from the 19th and the 20th centuries on immigration, foreign countries, and an immigrant’s new environment abroad (a case study). Those who strongly opposed im migration likened it to a »cancerous growth on the body of our nation.« This view was emphasized especially in the period of mass emigration to the USA and in the 1930’s.

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja Mateja Ratej je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.
publication.TITLE: Jugoslovani iz zadrege ali iz prepričanja in veselja? Razumevanje patriotizma in odnos do kraljeve dinastije Karađorđević pri Slovenski ljudski in Narodni radikalni stranki v letih 1918-1941

Yugoslavs out of Embarrassment Or out of Earnest Belief and Delight? The Concept of Patriotism and the Position of the Slovene People’s Party and of the National Radical Party on the Royal Karadjordjević Dynasty between 1918 and 1941
publication.SUBJECT: Slovenska ljudska stranka
Narodna radikalna stranka
patriotizem
jugoslovanska ideja
nacionalizem
Slovene People’s Party
National Radical Party
patriotism
the Yugoslav idea
nationalism
publication.DESCRIPTION: Avtorica se v prispevku ukvarja z vprašanjem patriotizma in odnosom do kraljeve dinastije Karađorđević pri SLS in NRS v letih 1918-1941. Patriotizem je bil najvidnejši in najbolj neposreden način politizacije jugoslovanske ideje pri obeh strankah ter je bil najizraziteje vezan na kraljevo dinastijo. V političnem diskurzu je bil kralj Aleksander Karađorđević najpomembnejši faktor generiranja in obstanka jugoslovanske ideje. SLS je v njegovi osebi na skupni imenovalec speljala politizacijo navidez nezdružljivih paradigem (jugoslovanskega) patriotizma, (slovenske) nacionalne zavesti in avtonomistične ideje, hkrati pa je SLS kraljevo vlogo interpretirala kot najpomembnejši agens za prehod od »velesrbske« mentalitete k jugoslovanski.

The paper focuses on the perception of the royal Karadjordjević dynasty by thè Slovene People’s Party (Slovenska ljudska stranka) and by the National Radicai Party (Narodna radikalna stranka) during the 1918-1941 period. In order to politicize the issue of Yugoslavia both parties utilized the concept of patriotism by focusing particularly on the royal dynasty, with King Aleksandar Karadjordjević portrayed as the principal agent and advocator of the Yugoslav issue. Using his royal status for its own agenda, the Slovene People’s Party combined and promoted three seemingly incompatible concepts, namely those of (Yugoslav) patriotism, (Slovene) national consciousness, and the idea of autonomy; at the same time, the king’s role had been interpreted as the most crucial factor in the transition from the »grandiose« Serbian mentality to Yugoslav mentality.

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja Jure Gombač je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.
publication.TITLE: Migracije in stereotipi
Primer optantov
Migrations and Stereotypes
The Case of the Optanti
publication.SUBJECT: stereotipi
migracije
optanti
stereotypes
migrations
the optanti
publication.DESCRIPTION: Avtor v svojem prispevku s pomočjo zgodovinskega primera skuša opozoriti na specifično oblikovanje stereotipov znotraj migracijskih procesov. Tipe migracij namreč določajo prostor, čas in motivacija, kar pa je večkrat težko določiti. Včasih prav zaradi posebnosti stereotipov, da za svoj nastanek potrebujejo določen čas, prostor in okolje, zgodovinski pogled postane nepogrešljiv pripomoček drugim družboslovnim in humanističnim vedam pri njihovem raziskovanju. Ta pristop se skuša preizkusiti na primeru pojma optanti, ko se zgodovinsko ozadje sooči z družboslovnim «definicijami stereotipa.

Using his case study of the optanti as the basis for his research the author analyzes the formation of stereotypes within the process of migration. Migration types are namely defined by time, by locale, and by motivation, the last of which may be somewhat difficult to defìne. In order to be conceived, stereotypes need a certain place, a certain time, and specific circumstances. At this point, history with its peculiar view becomes an indispensable tool for the humanities and for other social disciplines in the course of their research. This approach was applied in the case study of the optanti in which the necessary historical background is confronted with definitions of a stereotype as it is perceived by the social sciences.

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja Kristina Toplak je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.
publication.TITLE: "Mit o domovini"
Slovenija v likovnih upodobitvah Slovencev po svetu
publication.SUBJECT: mit o domovini
Slovenci v Argentini

publication.DESCRIPTION: Avtorica idealizirano podobo domovine Slovenije v likovnih delih slovenskih ustvarjalcev v Argentini in Avstraliji povezuje z domnevnimi »miti o domovini«, konstruiranjem krajine kot nacionalnega simbola in slovensko likovno tradicijo.

Analyzed is an idealized image of Slovenia in the paintings by Slovene immigrant artists living in Argentina and Australia. The author of this paper suggests a connection between these paintings and the reputed “myths about the homeland,” a construction of a landscape as a national symbol, and the Slovene painting tradition.

publication.TITLE: Evropski vplivi na politično gibanje slovenskih katoličanov
European Influence on the Political Movement of Slovenian Catholics
publication.SUBJECT: zgodovina političnih idej
politični katolicizem
krščansko-socialni nauk
krščanski socializem
avtoritarno korporativizem
history of politicai ideas
politicai Catholicism
Christian social teachings
Christian socialism
authoritarian corporativism
publication.DESCRIPTION: Referat poskuša pokazati razvoj političnega katolicizma v Evropi, v katerem ob koncu 19. stoletja prevlada krščansko-socialna smer, in njegovo sprejemanje na Slovenskem v obliki krščansko-socialnega gibanja Janeza Evangelista Kreka. Nadalje razloži in analizira razvoj političnega katolicizma oziroma krščansko-socialnega gibanja v Evropi med obema vojnama, ki se pod vplivom treh totalitarizmov in krize liberalne demokracije diferencira v tri smeri: neko tradicionalno, krščansko-socialno, zavezano encikliki Rerum novarum; na levičarsko krščansko-socialistično, ki se pravzaprav izloča iz političnega katolicizma in prehaja na socialistične poglede; na desno regresivno voluntaristično korporativistično, ki postaja podobna fašističnim socialnim pogledom. Vse tri smeri so imele svoje posnemovalce tudi na Slovenskem. Najbolj izvirna smer je slovenski krščanski socializem, kije v vsenarodnem merilu dosegel največji obseg med vsemi evropskimi narodi inje šel v svojih pogledih in politični poti najbolj na levo, ko je skupaj s komunisti leta 1941 ustanovil Osvobodilno fronto.

This paper tries to show the development of politicai Catholicism in Europe, in which at thè end of the 19th Century the Christian social direction prevails, and its acceptance in Slovenia in the form of the Christian social movement of Janez Evangelist Krek. Furthermore, it explains and analyses the development of political Catholicism or the Christian social movement in Europe between the two world wars, which was divided into three directions under the influence of three totalitarianisms and a crisis of the liberal democracy: into a traditional, Christian social direction, dedicated to the Rerum novarum encyclical; into a left-wing Christian social direction, which, in fact, separated itself from politicai Catholicism and moved over to socialist views; into a right-wing regressive voluntaristic corporativist direction, which became more and more similar to Fascist social views. All three directions had followers in Slovenia as well. The most original direction was that of the Slovenian Christian socialism which, in an international scale, covered the largest scope among all European nations and whose views and politicai paths led the most to the lefit, since it established the Liberation Front together with the Communists in 1941.

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja Aleš Gabrič je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.

Opposition or Contradiction to the New Government of 1945
publication.SUBJECT: kritike oblasti
opozicija

criticism of the authorities
opposition
Slovenia
Union of Democratic Youth
publication.DESCRIPTION: Avtor polemizira s stereotipoma o podpori oziroma nasprotovanju novi oblasti iz leta 1945 in o moči oziroma nemoči njene politične opozicije. Prvi stereotip, da je oblast uživala absolutno podporo prebivalstva in da so bile izjeme zgolj okupatorjevi sodelavci in agenti tujih držav, so v povojnem obdobju spodbujali komunisti. Drugega, da je močno opozicijsko voljo ljudi iz stvarnosti izbrisal zgolj teror politične policije komunističnega režima, so od padanja komunističnega režima naprej spodbujali ostri kritiki večinoma desničarskega političnega naziranja. V prispevku avtor zavrača obe stereotipni naziranji, saj nista podkrepljeni z nikakršnimi analizami tedanje stvarnosti. Ob tem opozarja, da nasprotovanja in kritik oblasti ne moremo preprosto enačiti s politično opozicijo. Za razliko od Srbije in Hrvaške, kjer je leta 1945 delovanje prijavilo tudi več opozicijskih strank, do tega v Sloveniji ni prišlo. Toda v Sloveniji je Osvobodilna fronta, za katero se je skrivala Komunistična partija Slovenije, že obvladovala večino političnega prostora in pritegnila v svoje vrste velik del prebivalstva, ki je bil pred vojno še naklonjen tradicionalnim slovenskim strankam. Na jugoslovanski ravni pa je morala Komunistična partija Jugoslavije šele ustvariti močno Ljudsko fronto, za katero bi lahko skrila svoje dolgoročne cilje, preoblikovati Jugoslavijo v državo sovjetskega tipa. Ob spraševanju, zakaj je bil politični položaj v Sloveniji leta 1945 precej drugačen kot v Srbiji ali na Hrvaškem, je vsekakor potrebno upoštevati tudi te dejavnike, ki pa jih kreatorji stereotipov preprosto izpuščajo.

Examined are the stereotype about the support of and the opposition to the new authorities in 1945 and the stereotype about the power and weakness of their political opposition. The first stereotype, stimulated by the Communists after the war, states that the Communist government had been wholeheartedly supported by the people. The only exceptions, according to this concept, were enemy collaborators and foreign agents. Since the downfall of the Communist regime at the end of the 20th Century rigorous, mostly right-wing critics have been voicing their conviction that it was only the terror of the Communist politicai (secret) police that extinguished the strong oppositional will of the people. The author posits that neither of the two stereotypes has been substantiated by an analysis of the actual situation. It is his belief that contradiction to and criticism of the government cannot be equaled to politicai opposition. In contrast to Serbia and Croatia, where in 1945 several oppositional politicai parties appeared on the politicai scene, this did not occur in Slovenia. This was because the Liberation Front, which was a cover for the Communist Party, had already occupied most of the available politicai space. It was upheld by a large proportion of those who prior to the war had supported traditional Slovene parties. The Communist Party of Yugoslavia, on the other hand, had yet to create a strong People’s Front in order to conceal its long-term politicai goal, namely to transform Yugoslavia into a Soviet-type state. In order to establish why the politicai situation in Slovenia was so different from the ones in Serbia and in Croatia these factors have to be taken into account. Yet the creators o f such stereotypes simply omit them.

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja Božo Repe je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.
publication.TITLE: Mit in resničnost komunizma
The Myth and the Reality of Communism
publication.SUBJECT: revizija zgodovine
vloga komunistične ideologije in stranke v slovenski družbi
revision of History
the role of the Communist Party and communist ideology in Slovene society
publication.DESCRIPTION: Avtor v prvem delu prispevka razpravlja o vzrokih za prevrednotenje (revizijo) novejše zgodovine. Vzroke vidi v novih odkritjih in spoznanjih slovenskega in evropskega zgodovinopisja; v spremenjenih razmerah v Evropi in svetu ter s tem povezanimi poskusi drugačnega vrednotenja zgodovine in zgodovinskih simbolov (čeprav naj bi protifašizem ostajal temeljna vrednota sodobne evropske družbe) in v spremenjeni ideološki in politični podobi Slovenije v zadnjih letih. V drugem delu prispevka je obravnavan odnos do komunistične ideologije in do komunistov v posameznih obdobjih slovenske zgodovine od konca prve svetovne vojne do danes. Avtor zaključuje z ugotovitvijo, da se želi nihalo bolj uravnoteženega zgodovinopisja, ki ga je stroka uspela v zadnjih dvajsetih letih nekako »zaustaviti« na sredini, potisniti na drugi skrajni rob (»domobranska resnica namesto »partizanske resnice«). Takim pogledom naj bi prilagodili javno predstavljanje zgodovine.

The paper first examines the principal reasons for a revaluation of recent history. There are several reasons for this revision: new findings in Slovene and European historiographies; considerably different circumstances in Europe, and in the world in general, that have triggered new attempts at revaluation of history and its symbols (although the antifascist stance remains one of the basic principles of modern European society); and recent ideological and politicai changes within Slovenia. The second chapter investigates Slovene attitude to communists and communist ideology since the end of the First World War. In conclusion, the author states that the pendulum of a more balanced historiography that historians had managed to position roughly in the middle now tends to be pushed to the opposite side (favoring the “homeguard” truth instead of the “partisan” truth of the past) and presented to public accordingly.

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja Egon Pelikan je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.
publication.TITLE: Vsi antikomunisti - vsi demokrati
All Anti-Communists - All Democrats
publication.SUBJECT: Jugoslavija
ideologije
komunizem
antikomunizem
demokracija
politični katolicizem
katoliška desnica
Yugoslavia
ideologies
communism
anticommunism
democracy
political Catholicism
Catolic right-wing party
publication.DESCRIPTION: Mit o »antikomunistih - demokratih« je nastal po osamosvojitvi Republike Slovenije, v emigraciji pa je obstajal že prej, kar je do določene mere razumljivo že zaradi totalitarnega sistema v tedanji Sloveniji znotraj socialistične Jugoslavije. Poskusi prikaza idejnih in političnih pozicij vrste ideologov s strani slovenske katoliške desnice kot stališč, ki naj bi bile povsem v sozvočju s postulati demokratične družbe, kot so jo razumeli tedaj in kot jo razumemo danes, nedvomno spadajo v ta kontekst. Pojav danes ni prisoten samo v Sloveniji, ampak v vsej vzhodni post-socialistični Evropi, saj gre za prav posebno »postmoderno« obliko utrjevanja mita, pri kateri antikomunizem v politični rabi omogoči vzpostavljanje aktualne pozicije posameznikov in posameznih družbenih skupin (v časih komunizma so temu rekli »družbenopolitične« vloge), skladno s poznano mislijo še bolj poznanega evropskega diktatorja-» če Judov ne bi bilo, bi si jih bili morali izmisliti«. Posebno vlogo znotraj teh strategij ima seveda manipulacija z zgodovinopisjem.

The myth about »the anti-communists versus the democrats« originated after Slovenia gained its independence in 1991. Yet it had already existed among Slovene immigrants, which is perfectly understandable - up to a point - in view of the totalitarian system during the period when Slovenia was still part of socialist Yugoslavia. An attempt to depict idcas and politicai positions of ideologists from the ranks of Slovene Catholic right-wing orientation, presum ably in perfect accord with the postulates of democratie society as it had been understood at the time and is still understood today, undeniably fall within this context. This belief is typical not only of present-day Slovenia but of all post-socialist countries in Eastern Europe. By applying a specific »postmodem« method of strengthening this myth an anticommunist stance, used in politicai context, enables the construction of prominent positions for individuate and social groups (such positions were termed »sociopolitical« roles during communism). This is in accord with the well-known statement by a noted European dictator: » If the Jews didn’t exist, we would have to invent them.« And manipulation with historiography certainly plays a very special role within these strategies.

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja Milan Pahor je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.
publication.TITLE: (Pra)strah italijanskega Trsta pred slovensko in slovansko "nevarnostjo"
Italians of Trieste and Their Primal Fear of Slovene and Slavic "Peril"
publication.SUBJECT: strah
nevarnost
slovenski
slovanski
italijanski
Trst
fear
danger
Slovene
Slavic
Italian
Trieste
publication.DESCRIPTION: V Trstu na stičišču latinskega sveta s slovenskim in slovanskim se je v zadnjih 150-ih letih vgnezdil strah pred t. i. slovensko in slovansko »nevarnostjo«. Italijanski romanski svet ni znal izkoristiti možnosti, da bi se na robu dveh kultur razvil dialog in politika sožitja, torej obojestranska obogatitev in oplemenitev. Namesto sožitja je prevladal strah pred novim in zato neznanim slovenskim svetom. Slovenski narodni preporod je povzročil strah pred tako prisotnostjo v mestu. Omenjeno stanje je po prvi vojni izkoristi fašizem do take mere, da je uzakonil politiko nasilja nad slovenskim prebivalstvom Julijske krajine. Po drugi vojni je bilo dodatno vse pogojeno od problema eksodusa iz Istre, ki je delno spremenil sestavo prebivalstva in od žgočega problema fojb. Na eni strani strah, na drugi strani pa stalno ponavljanje zgodbe o višji rasi in kulturi. Rečenica o »italiani, brava gente« in istočasno prekritje fašističnih zločinov, ki jih lahko ponazorimo z besedami: Narodni dom v Trstu, Bazovica, Gonars, Rab, Rižarna v Trstu. Prepletanje mitov in stereotipov na stičišču narodov in kultur.

During the last 150 years, fear of the so-called Slovene and Slavic »peril« settled in Trieste, a town at the crossroads of two worlds, the Latin and the Slavic. Italians were not able to turn to advantage the possibility for dialog and coexistence between the two cultures that would resuit in mutual growth and enrichment. The Slovene national revival triggered considerable anxiety over the unknown, and therefore fearful, Slavic culture. After the First World War the fascist regime legalized the policy of violence over the Slovene population of Venezia Giulia (Julijska krajina). When the Second World War ended, the situation was further com plicated because of the exodus from Istria that considerably changed the population structure in that area, and the burning question of the fojbe, mass graves of Italian victims executed at the end of the war. There has been fear of Slovenes among the Italians of Trieste yet, simultaneously, their repetitions about the superiority of the Italian race and culture; the slogan about the »Italiani, brava gente« on one side and the concealm ent of fascist crimes committed in the Slovene National Home in Trieste, in Bazzoviza (Bazovica), in the concentration camps in Gonars and Rab, in the Trieste rice-mill (Rižarna), an so on: an interconnection of myths and stereotypes at the crossroads of nations and cultures.

publication.DESCRIPTION: Avtorica se v prispevku ukvarja z interpretacijo majske deklaracije pri Slovenski ljudski stranki med obema svetovnima vojnama glede na strankin odnos do srbske Narodne radikalne stranke. Spričo modifikacij interpretacije se sprašuje ali je politična refleksija sploh možna, opozarja na distinkcijo med dogodkom in njegovo interpretacijo ter ponuja v razmislek trditev nekaterih teoretikov politične filozofije, da dogodek ni drugega kot njegova interpretacija in sicer interpretacija, ki jo je potrebno analizirati iz trenutka, v katerem (in zaradi katerega) je nastala.

Avtorica se v prispevku ukvarja z interpretacijo majske deklaracije pri Slovenski ljudski stranki med obema svetovnima vojnama glede na strankin odnos do srbske Narodne radikalne stranke. Spričo modifikacij interpretacije se sprašuje ali je politična refleksija sploh možna, opozarja na distinkcijo med dogodkom in njegovo interpretacijo ter ponuja v razmislek trditev nekaterih teoretikov politične filozofije, da dogodek ni drugega kot njegova interpretacija in sicer interpretacija, ki jo je potrebno analizirati iz trenutka, v katerem (in zaradi katerega) je nastala.

publication.TITLE: Rokovnjaški mit
The Myth about the Brigands
publication.SUBJECT: rokovnjaštvo
roparji
mit
zgodovina
društva
literatura
brigands
robbers
myth
History
societies
literature
publication.DESCRIPTION: Preprosti ljudje so vedno potrebovali svoje ljudske junake, na katere so prenašali svoje želje po kljubovanju zatiralski gospodi in oblasti. To robinhudovsko vlogo so pri nas dodelili rokovnjačem. Vendar pa rokovnjači niso bili nikakršni romantični junaki, ki bi ropali bogate in dajali revnim, ampak nasilneži, ki so se jih bali vsi ljudje. Navadne ljudi so zažirali za dnevni živež, bogate pa so ropali in tudi morili. S časom pa je želja po socialnem mitu prevladala nad pozabljenimi dejstvi in danes rokovnjač predstavlja nagajivega in neposlušnega pohajkača.

Simple people have always felt the need for folk heroes on whom they could project their wish to withstand the oppressing nobility and the ruling authorities. In Slovenia, this Robin-Hood role had been attributed to brigands. Far from being romantic heroes robbing the rich to give to the poor, these bandits were bullies feared by everyone. They were stealing from the poor, taking their meager daily eamings, and robbed, occasionally even murdered, the rich. But the yearning for a social myth gradually prevailed over the long-forgotten facts. The present concept of a brigand evokes only an image of a disobedient and mischievous vagabond.

publication.COPYRIGHT: To delo avtorja Damir Globočnik je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva-Nekomercijalno-Brez predelav 4.0 International licenco.
publication.TITLE: Stereotipi v karikaturi
Stereotypes in Cartoons
publication.SUBJECT: stereotipi
karikatura
narodni stereotipi
narodne personifikacije
satirični list
stereotype
cartoon
national stereotypes
national personifications
satirical newspapers
publication.DESCRIPTION: Pri razširjanju stereotipov je posebna vloga pripadla satiričnim listom oziroma karikaturi, ki je zaradi zmožnosti vizualizacije v podzavest vtisnjenih stereotipov postala nepogrešljiva v propagandnem in političnem boju. Prispevek obravnava dvoje stereotipnih motivnih vzorcev, ki sta v slovenski časopisni karikaturi relativno pogosta: prikaze Slovencev (najpogostejši slovenski avtostereotip v karikaturi je »Kranjski Janez« v narodni noši, kmalu se mu pridruži sorodna ženska figura), Nemcev oziroma nemškutarjev (razpoznavni znamenji sta frak in cilinder) in predstavnikov drugih narodov in prikaze izkoriščanja Slovencev (do prve svetovne vojne karikature opozarjajo na nemško, po vojni pa na srbsko izkoriščanje Slovencev). V »tuji« karikaturi se Slovenci in slovenski politični dogodki konec 19. in na začetku 20. stoletja pojavljajo le izjemoma. Ker so avstrijski Nemci slabo poznali Slovence, se v dunajskih satiričnih listih ni izoblikovala stereotipna predstavitev Slovenca.

A specific role in the dissemination of stereotypes had been played by satiric newspapers and their satirizing cartoons. Possessing an ability to visualize stereotypes deeply engraved into the subconscious the cartoon became a strong and indispensable weapon in political and propaganda battles. The present article describes two stereotype motives that were quite frequent in Slovene newspaper cartoons. The first, portraying Slovenes, depicts the most recurrent Slovene caricature auto-stereotype, the so-called »Kranjski Janez« clad in national costume; the male figure was soon joined by a similarly dressed female figure. The second portrays the Germans and their ardent supporters, all clearly recognizable by tails and top hat. Newspapers, which featured cartoons of other nations as well, often depicted exploitation of Slovenes (up to the Second World War by the Germans, afterwards by the Serbs). Slovenes and political events taking place within Slovenia at the end of the 19th and the beginning of the 20th centuries rarely appeared in cartoons published in foreign publications. Since the Germans who lived in Austria did not know much about the Slovenes a stereotype of the Slovene never made it to the pages of Viennese satirical papers.

publication.TITLE: Stereotipno o zgodovinskem spominu na slovenske Jude
Stereotypes about Historic Memories of Slovene Jews
publication.SUBJECT: Judje
judovstvo
judovska skupnost
sinagoga
antisemitizem
holokavst
Murska Sobota
Lendava
Prekmurje
Jews
Judaism
Jewish community
synagogue
anti-Semitism
holocaust
Murska Sobota
Lendava
Prekmurje
publication.DESCRIPTION: Judje so v preteklosti srednjeveške Evrope odigrali izjemno pomembno vlogo na gospodarskem in kulturnem področju. Na današnjem slovenskem ozemlju so se v 12. in 13. stoletju naselili v koroških in štajerskih mestih in v njih razvili živahno gospodarsko dejavnost. Po srednjeveških izgonih iz Koroške, Štajerske in Kranjske med leti 1496 - 1515 je bila njihova prisotnost vse do 18. stoletja izjemno skromna. Od 18. stoletja dalje jih v večjem številu najdemo v Prekmurju, kjer jih je bilo največ na prelomu 19. in 20. stoletja. V holokavstu druge svetovne vojne je bila prekmurska vplivna in organizacijsko trdna judovska skupnost skoraj povsem uničena. Ostali so le ostanki njenih ostankov, ki so bili postopoma potisnjeni na rob socialnega in zgodovinskega spomina in iz njega počasi celo povsem izbrisani. Do izraza je prišla kriptična prisotnost Judov v Sloveniji, ki jo je spremljal tudi svojevrstni »antisemitizem brez Judov«. Poglavitni stereotip, s katerim smo soočeni tudi v samostojni Sloveniji po letu 1991 je, da v Sloveniji Judov ni, oziroma je njihova prisotnost povsem obrobna.

Jews played an extremely important role in the culture and economy of medieval Europe. They settled in the territory of present-day Slovenia in the 12th and the 13th centuries, mostly in the towns of Koroško and Štajersko, where they soon developed flourishing economic activities. Between 1496 and 1515, after they had been banished from Koroško, Štajersko and Kranjsko, the Jewish population decreased sharply. Upon their return in the 18th Century most of them settled in the region of Prekmurje where they were most numerous at the tum of the 19th Century. But the once influential Jewish community with strong institutional life was almost completely destroyed in the holocaust. The few survivors that remained were gradually pushed to the edge of social and historic awareness and eventually even completely erased from memory. This cryptic presence of the Jewish community in Slovenia was accompanied by a specific form of »anti-Semitism with no Jews«. The principal stereotype about the Jews in Slovenia that has persisted to this day holds that there are no Jews in Slovenia; if, however, there are some their presence is hardly relevant.

publication.TITLE: Jezuiti kot kranjski izobraženci 18. stoletja
Jesuit as Carniolian Intellectuals of 18th Century
publication.SUBJECT: Jezuiti
Ljubljana
zgodovina znanosti
18. stoletje
Gabrijel Gruber
Jesuits
Ljubljana
History of Science
18th century
Gabriel Gruber
publication.DESCRIPTION: Jezuiti so v Ljubljani predavali na višjih filozofskih študijih od leta 1704 do leta 1773, kot raz-jezuiti pa so obdržali predavanja matematike in fizike še do leta 1802 oziroma 1803. Tako je bilo 18. stoletje v veliki meri doba jezuitskih eksaktnih znanosti na Kranjskem. Ljubljanski jezuiti Erbergi so leta 1751 tudi uradno razvili fizikalno-matematični kabinet z eksperimentalnimi napravami, oskrbeli odlično knjižnico in sami objavili številne odmevne knjige. Jezuiti so preko Gabrijela Grubeija poldrugo desetletje vodili večino gradbenih, vodovodnih in transportnih dejavnosti v deželi in zunaj njenih meja. Kljub temu so v slovenskem zgodovinopisju do nedavnega prevladovala mnenja o nizki ravni jezuitskega pouka v Ljubljani. Zakaj? Večina ljubljanskih jezuitov je bila domačega, predvsem plemenitega rodu iz družin Erbergov, Tauffererjev, Valvasorjev, Turjačanov in drugih. Kljub temu se jih še danes pogosto drži netočen pridevek prišlekov, torej tujcev v lastni domovini. V prispevku bomo skušali pojasniti vir tega stereotipa s prepričljivimi dokazi o njegovi napačnosti. Ob tem postavljamo zapleteno politično vprašanje: Ali ni bila jezuitska visoka šola resničen začetek ljubljanske univerze (kot je bila podobna šola v Zagrebu)? V prispevku prvič objavljamo posnetek zapisa o krstu Gabrijela Gruberja. Dokument odkriva očetovo ime, ki doslej ni bilo znano. Ob njem je ime matere, ki je bilo že večkrat objavljeno, vendar z določenimi dvomi. Raziskovanje prinaša nov kamenček v mozaiku iskanja porekla našega velikega jezuita, ki je moral tako dolgo čakati na svojega življenjepisca.

Jesuits of Ljubljana taught at higher studies between 1704 and 1773, and as ex-Jesuits kept their chairs for mathematics until 1802 and physics even a year later. Therefore 18th Century was in its large part an era of the Jesuit sciences in Carniola. Ljubljanian Jesuits Erbergs in 1751 even officially developed the Physic-mathem atical cabinet with new experimental devices, bought up an excellent new items for the library, and last but not least, themselves published several well received books. In the person of the Jesuit Gabrijel Gruber Jesuits leaded most of architectural, hydraulic and transport achievements at the country of Carniola and outside its borders. In spite of that at the older Slovenian historiography prevailed the opinion of the low level of the Jesuit high school of Ljubljana. Why? Most of Ljubljanian Jesuits were of the domestic mostly noble origin of the families Erberg, Taufferer, Valvasor, Auersperg, and others. In contrast to that well established fact they were until recently stili forced to bear the wrong characteristic of new comers that is foreigners in their own homeland. In this report w e will try to put at the limelight the source of that stereotype with the evident proof of its old fashion and even wrongness. By gathering enough information about our past, we want to pose a difficult politicai question: were not the Jesuit higher studies the true beginning of the Ljubljanian university as it happened, for example, in Zagreb? For the first time in historiography the Gruber’s Vienna baptismal certificate is published. It shows previously unknown Gabriel father’s name. It also clears some doubts about Gabriel’s mother Josepha. The research is a small stone at the mosaic o f the genealogy of our greatest Jesuit. With that little innovation we pay respect to Gruber eminence. Why did he have to wait so long for his biographer?

A Case of the "Purest Fight for National Liberation," or Clearly a Prologue to "Communist Revolution"?
